alert.note: Alert for McHenry (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 05 at 7:08PM CDT until July 06 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CDT TONIGHT... ...REPLACES FLOOD ADVISORY PREVIOUSLY IN EFFECT FOR PORTIONS OF MCHENRY COUNTY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of north central Illinois and northeast Illinois, including the following areas, in north central Illinois, Boone. In northeast Illinois, McHenry. * WHEN...Until midnight CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 706 PM CDT, doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Up to 3 inches of rain have fallen, with additional slow-moving thunderstorms moving into the area. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches may occur, with highest additional rainfall totals likely southwest and south of Woodstock. - Some locations that will experience minor flooding include... Crystal Lake, Algonquin, Lake in the Hills, McHenry, Belvidere, Woodstock, Huntley, Loves Park, Fox Lake, Harvard, Island Lake, Marengo, Poplar Grove, Cary, Hampshire, Johnsburg, Lakemoor, Spring Grove, Candlewick Lake and Fox River Grove. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory means minor flooding along waterways and other poor drainage areas is imminent or may already be occurring. Persons in the advisory area should use caution and avoid flood waters.
